text:
Social media folks! I need your help.

I’m looking at ramping up our company’s Twitter page and would love to know strategies that have worked for you in increasing engagement and followers. Things like the format of content, frequency, time etc.

If there are case studies that you’ve written or come across, please send it over. Thanks :smile:

We’re a B2B SaaS company in the conversational AI space.

elements.text:
Social media folks! I need your help.

I’m looking at ramping up our company’s Twitter page and would love to know strategies that have worked for you in increasing engagement and followers. Things like the format of content, frequency, time etc.

If there are case studies that you’ve written or come across, please send it over. Thanks
We’re a B2B SaaS company in the conversational AI space.

text: This message was deleted.

Experimenting with timing is the only way you'll get the time one locked down. Everyone's audience is different. Some tools will tell you this over time, but if you're not posting 10 a day, you can see this for yourself.

elements.text: Experimenting with timing is the only way you'll get the time one locked down. Everyone's audience is different. Some tools will tell you this over time, but if you're not posting 10 a day, you can see this for yourself.

text:
A few things that work well for us:
• Post regularly and vary formats (video, image, threads...)
• Interact with partners, influencers, media, etc from your industry
• Share content from other sources, not only yours and mention them
• Join Twitter Chats or organize one

elements.text: A few things that work well for us:
Post regularly and vary formats (video, image, threads...)
Interact with partners, influencers, media, etc from your industry
Share content from other sources, not only yours and mention them
Join Twitter Chats or organize one

text: Hi all, I'm curious if anyone has really successful examples of content promotion or link building (to a specific post) that they could share? I'm working on a new website with zero authority and we have a hub and spoke piece in the works along with a few other great data-driven pieces. Given that it's a brand new site, we aren't expecting much right off the bat, but it would be nice to expedite the process. I've read about doing non-spammy community promotion like Grow and Convert does, though even they admitted in a post that it doesn't work as well as it used to. I also think this would be difficult to do on your client's behalf as you really have to be invested in the community and industry to do this. I listened to an interview at Siege Media they do a lot of very targeted outreach, but (putting myself in the link prospect's shoes) even if I linked to a similar stat in the past, I don't think I'd stop what I'm doing to link to your post instead. I'd love any thoughts or suggestions!

elements.text: Hi all, I'm curious if anyone has really successful examples of content promotion or link building (to a specific post) that they could share? I'm working on a new website with zero authority and we have a hub and spoke piece in the works along with a few other great data-driven pieces. Given that it's a brand new site, we aren't expecting much right off the bat, but it would be nice to expedite the process. I've read about doing non-spammy community promotion like Grow and Convert does, though even they admitted in a post that it doesn't work as well as it used to. I also think this would be difficult to do on your client's behalf as you really have to be invested in the community and industry to do this. I listened to an interview at Siege Media they do a lot of very targeted outreach, but (putting myself in the link prospect's shoes) even if I linked to a similar stat in the past, I don't think I'd stop what I'm doing to link to your post instead. I'd love any thoughts or suggestions!

text:
I have a bunch of examples of how I do it, but really it focuses on ranking for things that build links automatically (at the very least, publishing that content and building links to those pieces manually.. they're also the kinds of articles that are the easiest to build links to via outreach).  Those are:

• The future of X
• The history of X
• free tools for X
• best tools for X
• A glossary (all the "what is")
• X trends
• X statistics
• and a few others.

elements.text: I have a bunch of examples of how I do it, but really it focuses on ranking for things that build links automatically (at the very least, publishing that content and building links to those pieces manually.. they're also the kinds of articles that are the easiest to build links to via outreach).  Those are:
The future of X
The history of X
free tools for X
best tools for X
A glossary (all the "what is")
X trends
X statistics
and a few others.

text: Definitely start with internal links. You can do a "site:<http://yoursite.com|yoursite.com> [keyword]" Google search to see articles where you can add links.

elements.text: Definitely start with internal links. You can do a "site:yoursite.com [keyword]" Google search to see articles where you can add links.

text: You can also use Ahrefs new internal link tool in their site audit, which I've found to be extremely helpful.

text: <@UJG9WTEKG> Curious if your team compared the benefits of internal vs. external linking in your research? While I understand the importance of internal linking, I have a difficult time understanding how much _effort_ we should be putting into this tactic vs. external linking tactics.

elements.text: Curious if your team compared the benefits of internal vs. external linking in your research? While I understand the importance of internal linking, I have a difficult time understanding how much
effort
we should be putting into this tactic vs. external linking tactics.

text: I know it won’t be an exact science, but I’m looking for research that suggests a hub with 15 spokes properly internally linked is as effective as getting 5 guests posts for the overall SEO benefit of your URL

elements.text: I know it won’t be an exact science, but I’m looking for research that suggests a hub with 15 spokes properly internally linked is as effective as getting 5 guests posts for the overall SEO benefit of your URL

text: <@U012R27LRJ8> that'll wholly depend on the strength of the website as a whole. It *has* to be a case by case basis for that.

elements.text: that'll wholly depend on the strength of the website as a whole. It
has
to be a case by case basis for that.

text: I think the most helpful framing here would not to position them on opposite sides. Guest post for links, but also for sites where folks will read it, then also do internal links in a smart way and don't limit them to any kind of "best practices" number. You don't have to turn your side into wikipedia (where every other word is an internal link), but do as many as would be helpful for readers.

elements.text: I think the most helpful framing here would not to position them on opposite sides. Guest post for links, but also for sites where folks will read it, then also do internal links in a smart way and don't limit them to any kind of "best practices" number. You don't have to turn your side into wikipedia (where every other word is an internal link), but do as many as would be helpful for readers.

text:
I'm in the same boat. A SaaS website at the ground floor. I've created several top of the funnel articles and now I'm adding several bottom of the funnel articles.

Another thing I've done is to create a video for (almost) each one and post it to YouTube. I added all relevant content and tags in the video and it links back to the article. We've seen a little traffic but it's still too new to see the full effect yet. 

But I'm excited about it!

elements.text: I'm in the same boat. A SaaS website at the ground floor. I've created several top of the funnel articles and now I'm adding several bottom of the funnel articles.

Another thing I've done is to create a video for (almost) each one and post it to YouTube. I added all relevant content and tags in the video and it links back to the article. We've seen a little traffic but it's still too new to see the full effect yet. 

But I'm excited about it!

Like it's not nicely produced or anything, but the point is to just share the knowledge!
